00001 
00002 # Scanner produces tokens of the following types:
00003 # STREAM-START
00004 # STREAM-END
00005 # DIRECTIVE(name, value)
00006 # DOCUMENT-START
00007 # DOCUMENT-END
00008 # BLOCK-SEQUENCE-START
00009 # BLOCK-MAPPING-START
00010 # BLOCK-END
00011 # FLOW-SEQUENCE-START
00012 # FLOW-MAPPING-START
00013 # FLOW-SEQUENCE-END
00014 # FLOW-MAPPING-END
00015 # BLOCK-ENTRY
00016 # FLOW-ENTRY
00017 # KEY
00018 # VALUE
00019 # ALIAS(value)
00020 # ANCHOR(value)
00021 # TAG(value)
00022 # SCALAR(value, plain, style)
00023 #
00024 # Read comments in the Scanner code for more details.
00025 #
00026 
00027 __all__ = ['Scanner', 'ScannerError']
00028 
00029 from error import MarkedYAMLError
00030 from tokens import *
00031 
00032 class ScannerError(MarkedYAMLError):
00033     pass
00034 
00035 class SimpleKey(object):
00036     # See below simple keys treatment.
00037 
00038     def __init__(self, token_number, required, index, line, column, mark):
00039         self.token_number = token_number
00040         self.required = required
00041         self.index = index
00042         self.line = line
00043         self.column = column
00044         self.mark = mark
00045 
00046 class Scanner(object):
00047 
00048     def __init__(self):
00049         """Initialize the scanner."""
00050         # It is assumed that Scanner and Reader will have a common descendant.
00051         # Reader do the dirty work of checking for BOM and converting the
00052         # input data to Unicode. It also adds NUL to the end.
00053         #
00054         # Reader supports the following methods
00055         #   self.peek(i=0)       # peek the next i-th character
00056         #   self.prefix(l=1)     # peek the next l characters
00057         #   self.forward(l=1)    # read the next l characters and move the pointer.
00058 
00059         # Had we reached the end of the stream?
00060         self.done = False
00061 
00062         # The number of unclosed '{' and '['. `flow_level == 0` means block
00063         # context.
00064         self.flow_level = 0
00065 
00066         # List of processed tokens that are not yet emitted.
00067         self.tokens = []
00068 
00069         # Add the STREAM-START token.
00070         self.fetch_stream_start()
00071 
00072         # Number of tokens that were emitted through the `get_token` method.
00073         self.tokens_taken = 0
00074 
00075         # The current indentation level.
00076         self.indent = -1
00077 
00078         # Past indentation levels.
00079         self.indents = []
00080 
00081         # Variables related to simple keys treatment.
00082 
00083         # A simple key is a key that is not denoted by the '?' indicator.
00084         # Example of simple keys:
00085         #   ---
00086         #   block simple key: value
00087         #   ? not a simple key:
00088         #   : { flow simple key: value }
00089         # We emit the KEY token before all keys, so when we find a potential
00090         # simple key, we try to locate the corresponding ':' indicator.
00091         # Simple keys should be limited to a single line and 1024 characters.
00092 
00093         # Can a simple key start at the current position? A simple key may
00094         # start:
00095         # - at the beginning of the line, not counting indentation spaces
00096         #       (in block context),
00097         # - after '{', '[', ',' (in the flow context),
00098         # - after '?', ':', '-' (in the block context).
00099         # In the block context, this flag also signifies if a block collection
00100         # may start at the current position.
00101         self.allow_simple_key = True
00102 
00103         # Keep track of possible simple keys. This is a dictionary. The key
00104         # is `flow_level`; there can be no more that one possible simple key
00105         # for each level. The value is a SimpleKey record:
00106         #   (token_number, required, index, line, column, mark)
00107         # A simple key may start with ALIAS, ANCHOR, TAG, SCALAR(flow),
00108         # '[', or '{' tokens.
00109         self.possible_simple_keys = {}
00110 
00111     # Public methods.
00112 
00113     def check_token(self, *choices):
00114         # Check if the next token is one of the given types.
00115         while self.need_more_tokens():
00116             self.fetch_more_tokens()
00117         if self.tokens:
00118             if not choices:
00119                 return True
00120             for choice in choices:
00121                 if isinstance(self.tokens[0], choice):
00122                     return True
00123         return False
00124 
00125     def peek_token(self):
00126         # Return the next token, but do not delete if from the queue.
00127         while self.need_more_tokens():
00128             self.fetch_more_tokens()
00129         if self.tokens:
00130             return self.tokens[0]
00131 
00132     def get_token(self):
00133         # Return the next token.
00134         while self.need_more_tokens():
00135             self.fetch_more_tokens()
00136         if self.tokens:
00137             self.tokens_taken += 1
00138             return self.tokens.pop(0)
00139 
00140     # Private methods.
00141 
00142     def need_more_tokens(self):
00143         if self.done:
00144             return False
00145         if not self.tokens:
00146             return True
00147         # The current token may be a potential simple key, so we
00148         # need to look further.
00149         self.stale_possible_simple_keys()
00150         if self.next_possible_simple_key() == self.tokens_taken:
00151             return True
00152 
00153     def fetch_more_tokens(self):
00154 
00155         # Eat whitespaces and comments until we reach the next token.
00156         self.scan_to_next_token()
00157 
00158         # Remove obsolete possible simple keys.
00159         self.stale_possible_simple_keys()
00160 
00161         # Compare the current indentation and column. It may add some tokens
00162         # and decrease the current indentation level.
00163         self.unwind_indent(self.column)
00164 
00165         # Peek the next character.
00166         ch = self.peek()
00167 
00168         # Is it the end of stream?
00169         if ch == u'\0':
00170             return self.fetch_stream_end()
00171 
00172         # Is it a directive?
00173         if ch == u'%' and self.check_directive():
00174             return self.fetch_directive()
00175 
00176         # Is it the document start?
00177         if ch == u'-' and self.check_document_start():
00178             return self.fetch_document_start()
00179 
00180         # Is it the document end?
00181         if ch == u'.' and self.check_document_end():
00182             return self.fetch_document_end()
00183 
00184         # TODO: support for BOM within a stream.
00185         #if ch == u'\uFEFF':
00186         #    return self.fetch_bom()    <-- issue BOMToken
00187 
00188         # Note: the order of the following checks is NOT significant.
00189 
00190         # Is it the flow sequence start indicator?
00191         if ch == u'[':
00192             return self.fetch_flow_sequence_start()
00193 
00194         # Is it the flow mapping start indicator?
00195         if ch == u'{':
00196             return self.fetch_flow_mapping_start()
00197 
00198         # Is it the flow sequence end indicator?
00199         if ch == u']':
00200             return self.fetch_flow_sequence_end()
00201 
00202         # Is it the flow mapping end indicator?
00203         if ch == u'}':
00204             return self.fetch_flow_mapping_end()
00205 
00206         # Is it the flow entry indicator?
00207         if ch == u',':
00208             return self.fetch_flow_entry()
00209 
00210         # Is it the block entry indicator?
00211         if ch == u'-' and self.check_block_entry():
00212             return self.fetch_block_entry()
00213 
00214         # Is it the key indicator?
00215         if ch == u'?' and self.check_key():
00216             return self.fetch_key()
00217 
00218         # Is it the value indicator?
00219         if ch == u':' and self.check_value():
00220             return self.fetch_value()
00221 
00222         # Is it an alias?
00223         if ch == u'*':
00224             return self.fetch_alias()
00225 
00226         # Is it an anchor?
00227         if ch == u'&':
00228             return self.fetch_anchor()
00229 
00230         # Is it a tag?
00231         if ch == u'!':
00232             return self.fetch_tag()
00233 
00234         # Is it a literal scalar?
00235         if ch == u'|' and not self.flow_level:
00236             return self.fetch_literal()
00237 
00238         # Is it a folded scalar?
00239         if ch == u'>' and not self.flow_level:
00240             return self.fetch_folded()
00241 
00242         # Is it a single quoted scalar?
00243         if ch == u'\'':
00244             return self.fetch_single()
00245 
00246         # Is it a double quoted scalar?
00247         if ch == u'\"':
00248             return self.fetch_double()
00249 
00250         # It must be a plain scalar then.
00251         if self.check_plain():
00252             return self.fetch_plain()
00253 
00254         # No? It's an error. Let's produce a nice error message.
00255         raise ScannerError("while scanning for the next token", None,
00256                 "found character %r that cannot start any token"
00257                 % ch.encode('utf-8'), self.get_mark())
00258 
00259     # Simple keys treatment.
00260 
00261     def next_possible_simple_key(self):
00262         # Return the number of the nearest possible simple key. Actually we
00263         # don't need to loop through the whole dictionary. We may replace it
00264         # with the following code:
00265         #   if not self.possible_simple_keys:
00266         #       return None
00267         #   return self.possible_simple_keys[
00268         #           min(self.possible_simple_keys.keys())].token_number
00269         min_token_number = None
00270         for level in self.possible_simple_keys:
00271             key = self.possible_simple_keys[level]
00272             if min_token_number is None or key.token_number < min_token_number:
00273                 min_token_number = key.token_number
00274         return min_token_number
00275 
00276     def stale_possible_simple_keys(self):
00277         # Remove entries that are no longer possible simple keys. According to
00278         # the YAML specification, simple keys
00279         # - should be limited to a single line,
00280         # - should be no longer than 1024 characters.
00281         # Disabling this procedure will allow simple keys of any length and
00282         # height (may cause problems if indentation is broken though).
00283         for level in self.possible_simple_keys.keys():
00284             key = self.possible_simple_keys[level]
00285             if key.line != self.line  \
00286                     or self.index-key.index > 1024:
00287                 if key.required:
00288                     raise ScannerError("while scanning a simple key", key.mark,
00289                             "could not found expected ':'", self.get_mark())
00290                 del self.possible_simple_keys[level]
00291 
00292     def save_possible_simple_key(self):
00293         # The next token may start a simple key. We check if it's possible
00294         # and save its position. This function is called for
00295         #   ALIAS, ANCHOR, TAG, SCALAR(flow), '[', and '{'.
00296 
00297         # Check if a simple key is required at the current position.
00298         required = not self.flow_level and self.indent == self.column
00299 
00300         # A simple key is required only if it is the first token in the current
00301         # line. Therefore it is always allowed.
00302         assert self.allow_simple_key or not required
00303 
00304         # The next token might be a simple key. Let's save it's number and
00305         # position.
00306         if self.allow_simple_key:
00307             self.remove_possible_simple_key()
00308             token_number = self.tokens_taken+len(self.tokens)
00309             key = SimpleKey(token_number, required,
00310                     self.index, self.line, self.column, self.get_mark())
00311             self.possible_simple_keys[self.flow_level] = key
00312 
00313     def remove_possible_simple_key(self):
00314         # Remove the saved possible key position at the current flow level.
00315         if self.flow_level in self.possible_simple_keys:
00316             key = self.possible_simple_keys[self.flow_level]
00317             
00318             if key.required:
00319                 raise ScannerError("while scanning a simple key", key.mark,
00320                         "could not found expected ':'", self.get_mark())
00321 
00322             del self.possible_simple_keys[self.flow_level]
00323 
00324     # Indentation functions.
00325 
00326     def unwind_indent(self, column):
00327 
00328         ## In flow context, tokens should respect indentation.
00329         ## Actually the condition should be `self.indent >= column` according to
00330         ## the spec. But this condition will prohibit intuitively correct
00331         ## constructions such as
00332         ## key : {
00333         ## }
00334         #if self.flow_level and self.indent > column:
00335         #    raise ScannerError(None, None,
00336         #            "invalid intendation or unclosed '[' or '{'",
00337         #            self.get_mark())
00338 
00339         # In the flow context, indentation is ignored. We make the scanner less
00340         # restrictive then specification requires.
00341         if self.flow_level:
00342             return
00343 
00344         # In block context, we may need to issue the BLOCK-END tokens.
00345         while self.indent > column:
00346             mark = self.get_mark()
00347             self.indent = self.indents.pop()
00348             self.tokens.append(BlockEndToken(mark, mark))
00349 
00350     def add_indent(self, column):
00351         # Check if we need to increase indentation.
00352         if self.indent < column:
00353             self.indents.append(self.indent)
00354             self.indent = column
00355             return True
00356         return False
00357 
00358     # Fetchers.
00359 
00360     def fetch_stream_start(self):
00361         # We always add STREAM-START as the first token and STREAM-END as the
00362         # last token.
00363 
00364         # Read the token.
00365         mark = self.get_mark()
00366         
00367         # Add STREAM-START.
00368         self.tokens.append(StreamStartToken(mark, mark,
00369             encoding=self.encoding))
00370         
00371 
00372     def fetch_stream_end(self):
00373 
00374         # Set the current intendation to -1.
00375         self.unwind_indent(-1)
00376 
00377         # Reset everything (not really needed).
00378         self.allow_simple_key = False
00379         self.possible_simple_keys = {}
00380 
00381         # Read the token.
00382         mark = self.get_mark()
00383         
00384         # Add STREAM-END.
00385         self.tokens.append(StreamEndToken(mark, mark))
00386 
00387         # The steam is finished.
00388         self.done = True
00389 
00390     def fetch_directive(self):
00391         
00392         # Set the current intendation to -1.
00393         self.unwind_indent(-1)
00394 
00395         # Reset simple keys.
00396         self.remove_possible_simple_key()
00397         self.allow_simple_key = False
00398 
00399         # Scan and add DIRECTIVE.
00400         self.tokens.append(self.scan_directive())
00401 
00402     def fetch_document_start(self):
00403         self.fetch_document_indicator(DocumentStartToken)
00404 
00405     def fetch_document_end(self):
00406         self.fetch_document_indicator(DocumentEndToken)
00407 
00408     def fetch_document_indicator(self, TokenClass):
00409 
00410         # Set the current intendation to -1.
00411         self.unwind_indent(-1)
00412 
00413         # Reset simple keys. Note that there could not be a block collection
00414         # after '---'.
00415         self.remove_possible_simple_key()
00416         self.allow_simple_key = False
00417 
00418         # Add DOCUMENT-START or DOCUMENT-END.
00419         start_mark = self.get_mark()
00420         self.forward(3)
00421         end_mark = self.get_mark()
00422         self.tokens.append(TokenClass(start_mark, end_mark))
00423 
00424     def fetch_flow_sequence_start(self):
00425         self.fetch_flow_collection_start(FlowSequenceStartToken)
00426 
00427     def fetch_flow_mapping_start(self):
00428         self.fetch_flow_collection_start(FlowMappingStartToken)
00429 
00430     def fetch_flow_collection_start(self, TokenClass):
00431 
00432         # '[' and '{' may start a simple key.
00433         self.save_possible_simple_key()
00434 
00435         # Increase the flow level.
00436         self.flow_level += 1
00437 
00438         # Simple keys are allowed after '[' and '{'.
00439         self.allow_simple_key = True
00440 
00441         # Add FLOW-SEQUENCE-START or FLOW-MAPPING-START.
00442         start_mark = self.get_mark()
00443         self.forward()
00444         end_mark = self.get_mark()
00445         self.tokens.append(TokenClass(start_mark, end_mark))
00446 
00447     def fetch_flow_sequence_end(self):
00448         self.fetch_flow_collection_end(FlowSequenceEndToken)
00449 
00450     def fetch_flow_mapping_end(self):
00451         self.fetch_flow_collection_end(FlowMappingEndToken)
00452 
00453     def fetch_flow_collection_end(self, TokenClass):
00454 
00455         # Reset possible simple key on the current level.
00456         self.remove_possible_simple_key()
00457 
00458         # Decrease the flow level.
00459         self.flow_level -= 1
00460 
00461         # No simple keys after ']' or '}'.
00462         self.allow_simple_key = False
00463 
00464         # Add FLOW-SEQUENCE-END or FLOW-MAPPING-END.
00465         start_mark = self.get_mark()
00466         self.forward()
00467         end_mark = self.get_mark()
00468         self.tokens.append(TokenClass(start_mark, end_mark))
00469 
00470     def fetch_flow_entry(self):
00471 
00472         # Simple keys are allowed after ','.
00473         self.allow_simple_key = True
00474 
00475         # Reset possible simple key on the current level.
00476         self.remove_possible_simple_key()
00477 
00478         # Add FLOW-ENTRY.
00479         start_mark = self.get_mark()
00480         self.forward()
00481         end_mark = self.get_mark()
00482         self.tokens.append(FlowEntryToken(start_mark, end_mark))
00483 
00484     def fetch_block_entry(self):
00485 
00486         # Block context needs additional checks.
00487         if not self.flow_level:
00488 
00489             # Are we allowed to start a new entry?
00490             if not self.allow_simple_key:
00491                 raise ScannerError(None, None,
00492                         "sequence entries are not allowed here",
00493                         self.get_mark())
00494 
00495             # We may need to add BLOCK-SEQUENCE-START.
00496             if self.add_indent(self.column):
00497                 mark = self.get_mark()
00498                 self.tokens.append(BlockSequenceStartToken(mark, mark))
00499 
00500         # It's an error for the block entry to occur in the flow context,
00501         # but we let the parser detect this.
00502         else:
00503             pass
00504 
00505         # Simple keys are allowed after '-'.
00506         self.allow_simple_key = True
00507 
00508         # Reset possible simple key on the current level.
00509         self.remove_possible_simple_key()
00510 
00511         # Add BLOCK-ENTRY.
00512         start_mark = self.get_mark()
00513         self.forward()
00514         end_mark = self.get_mark()
00515         self.tokens.append(BlockEntryToken(start_mark, end_mark))
00516 
00517     def fetch_key(self):
00518         
00519         # Block context needs additional checks.
00520         if not self.flow_level:
00521 
00522             # Are we allowed to start a key (not nessesary a simple)?
00523             if not self.allow_simple_key:
00524                 raise ScannerError(None, None,
00525                         "mapping keys are not allowed here",
00526                         self.get_mark())
00527 
00528             # We may need to add BLOCK-MAPPING-START.
00529             if self.add_indent(self.column):
00530                 mark = self.get_mark()
00531                 self.tokens.append(BlockMappingStartToken(mark, mark))
00532 
00533         # Simple keys are allowed after '?' in the block context.
00534         self.allow_simple_key = not self.flow_level
00535 
00536         # Reset possible simple key on the current level.
00537         self.remove_possible_simple_key()
00538 
00539         # Add KEY.
00540         start_mark = self.get_mark()
00541         self.forward()
00542         end_mark = self.get_mark()
00543         self.tokens.append(KeyToken(start_mark, end_mark))
00544 
00545     def fetch_value(self):
00546 
00547         # Do we determine a simple key?
00548         if self.flow_level in self.possible_simple_keys:
00549 
00550             # Add KEY.
00551             key = self.possible_simple_keys[self.flow_level]
00552             del self.possible_simple_keys[self.flow_level]
00553             self.tokens.insert(key.token_number-self.tokens_taken,
00554                     KeyToken(key.mark, key.mark))
00555 
00556             # If this key starts a new block mapping, we need to add
00557             # BLOCK-MAPPING-START.
00558             if not self.flow_level:
00559                 if self.add_indent(key.column):
00560                     self.tokens.insert(key.token_number-self.tokens_taken,
00561                             BlockMappingStartToken(key.mark, key.mark))
00562 
00563             # There cannot be two simple keys one after another.
00564             self.allow_simple_key = False
00565 
00566         # It must be a part of a complex key.
00567         else:
00568             
00569             # Block context needs additional checks.
00570             # (Do we really need them? They will be catched by the parser
00571             # anyway.)
00572             if not self.flow_level:
00573 
00574                 # We are allowed to start a complex value if and only if
00575                 # we can start a simple key.
00576                 if not self.allow_simple_key:
00577                     raise ScannerError(None, None,
00578                             "mapping values are not allowed here",
00579                             self.get_mark())
00580 
00581             # If this value starts a new block mapping, we need to add
00582             # BLOCK-MAPPING-START.  It will be detected as an error later by
00583             # the parser.
00584             if not self.flow_level:
00585                 if self.add_indent(self.column):
00586                     mark = self.get_mark()
00587                     self.tokens.append(BlockMappingStartToken(mark, mark))
00588 
00589             # Simple keys are allowed after ':' in the block context.
00590             self.allow_simple_key = not self.flow_level
00591 
00592             # Reset possible simple key on the current level.
00593             self.remove_possible_simple_key()
00594 
00595         # Add VALUE.
00596         start_mark = self.get_mark()
00597         self.forward()
00598         end_mark = self.get_mark()
00599         self.tokens.append(ValueToken(start_mark, end_mark))
00600 
00601     def fetch_alias(self):
00602 
00603         # ALIAS could be a simple key.
00604         self.save_possible_simple_key()
00605 
00606         # No simple keys after ALIAS.
00607         self.allow_simple_key = False
00608 
00609         # Scan and add ALIAS.
00610         self.tokens.append(self.scan_anchor(AliasToken))
00611 
00612     def fetch_anchor(self):
00613 
00614         # ANCHOR could start a simple key.
00615         self.save_possible_simple_key()
00616 
00617         # No simple keys after ANCHOR.
00618         self.allow_simple_key = False
00619 
00620         # Scan and add ANCHOR.
00621         self.tokens.append(self.scan_anchor(AnchorToken))
00622 
00623     def fetch_tag(self):
00624 
00625         # TAG could start a simple key.
00626         self.save_possible_simple_key()
00627 
00628         # No simple keys after TAG.
00629         self.allow_simple_key = False
00630 
00631         # Scan and add TAG.
00632         self.tokens.append(self.scan_tag())
00633 
00634     def fetch_literal(self):
00635         self.fetch_block_scalar(style='|')
00636 
00637     def fetch_folded(self):
00638         self.fetch_block_scalar(style='>')
00639 
00640     def fetch_block_scalar(self, style):
00641 
00642         # A simple key may follow a block scalar.
00643         self.allow_simple_key = True
00644 
00645         # Reset possible simple key on the current level.
00646         self.remove_possible_simple_key()
00647 
00648         # Scan and add SCALAR.
00649         self.tokens.append(self.scan_block_scalar(style))
00650 
00651     def fetch_single(self):
00652         self.fetch_flow_scalar(style='\'')
00653 
00654     def fetch_double(self):
00655         self.fetch_flow_scalar(style='"')
00656 
00657     def fetch_flow_scalar(self, style):
00658 
00659         # A flow scalar could be a simple key.
00660         self.save_possible_simple_key()
00661 
00662         # No simple keys after flow scalars.
00663         self.allow_simple_key = False
00664 
00665         # Scan and add SCALAR.
00666         self.tokens.append(self.scan_flow_scalar(style))
00667 
00668     def fetch_plain(self):
00669 
00670         # A plain scalar could be a simple key.
00671         self.save_possible_simple_key()
00672 
00673         # No simple keys after plain scalars. But note that `scan_plain` will
00674         # change this flag if the scan is finished at the beginning of the
00675         # line.
00676         self.allow_simple_key = False
00677 
00678         # Scan and add SCALAR. May change `allow_simple_key`.
00679         self.tokens.append(self.scan_plain())
00680 
00681     # Checkers.
00682 
00683     def check_directive(self):
00684 
00685         # DIRECTIVE:        ^ '%' ...
00686         # The '%' indicator is already checked.
00687         if self.column == 0:
00688             return True
00689 
00690     def check_document_start(self):
00691 
00692         # DOCUMENT-START:   ^ '---' (' '|'\n')
00693         if self.column == 0:
00694             if self.prefix(3) == u'---'  \
00695                     and self.peek(3) in u'\0 \t\r\n\x85\u2028\u2029':
00696                 return True
00697 
00698     def check_document_end(self):
00699 
00700         # DOCUMENT-END:     ^ '...' (' '|'\n')
00701         if self.column == 0:
00702             if self.prefix(3) == u'...'  \
00703                     and self.peek(3) in u'\0 \t\r\n\x85\u2028\u2029':
00704                 return True
00705 
00706     def check_block_entry(self):
00707 
00708         # BLOCK-ENTRY:      '-' (' '|'\n')
00709         return self.peek(1) in u'\0 \t\r\n\x85\u2028\u2029'
00710 
00711     def check_key(self):
00712 
00713         # KEY(flow context):    '?'
00714         if self.flow_level:
00715             return True
00716 
00717         # KEY(block context):   '?' (' '|'\n')
00718         else:
00719             return self.peek(1) in u'\0 \t\r\n\x85\u2028\u2029'
00720 
00721     def check_value(self):
00722 
00723         # VALUE(flow context):  ':'
00724         if self.flow_level:
00725             return True
00726 
00727         # VALUE(block context): ':' (' '|'\n')
00728         else:
00729             return self.peek(1) in u'\0 \t\r\n\x85\u2028\u2029'
00730 
00731     def check_plain(self):
00732 
00733         # A plain scalar may start with any non-space character except:
00734         #   '-', '?', ':', ',', '[', ']', '{', '}',
00735         #   '#', '&', '*', '!', '|', '>', '\'', '\"',
00736         #   '%', '@', '`'.
00737         #
00738         # It may also start with
00739         #   '-', '?', ':'
00740         # if it is followed by a non-space character.
00741         #
00742         # Note that we limit the last rule to the block context (except the
00743         # '-' character) because we want the flow context to be space
00744         # independent.
00745         ch = self.peek()
00746         return ch not in u'\0 \t\r\n\x85\u2028\u2029-?:,[]{}#&*!|>\'\"%@`'  \
00747                 or (self.peek(1) not in u'\0 \t\r\n\x85\u2028\u2029'
00748                         and (ch == u'-' or (not self.flow_level and ch in u'?:')))
00749 
00750     # Scanners.
00751 
00752     def scan_to_next_token(self):
00753         # We ignore spaces, line breaks and comments.
00754         # If we find a line break in the block context, we set the flag
00755         # `allow_simple_key` on.
00756         # The byte order mark is stripped if it's the first character in the
00757         # stream. We do not yet support BOM inside the stream as the
00758         # specification requires. Any such mark will be considered as a part
00759         # of the document.
00760         #
00761         # TODO: We need to make tab handling rules more sane. A good rule is
00762         #   Tabs cannot precede tokens
00763         #   BLOCK-SEQUENCE-START, BLOCK-MAPPING-START, BLOCK-END,
00764         #   KEY(block), VALUE(block), BLOCK-ENTRY
00765         # So the checking code is
00766         #   if <TAB>:
00767         #       self.allow_simple_keys = False
00768         # We also need to add the check for `allow_simple_keys == True` to
00769         # `unwind_indent` before issuing BLOCK-END.
00770         # Scanners for block, flow, and plain scalars need to be modified.
00771 
00772         if self.index == 0 and self.peek() == u'\uFEFF':
00773             self.forward()
00774         found = False
00775         while not found:
00776             while self.peek() == u' ':
00777                 self.forward()
00778             if self.peek() == u'#':
00779                 while self.peek() not in u'\0\r\n\x85\u2028\u2029':
00780                     self.forward()
00781             if self.scan_line_break():
00782                 if not self.flow_level:
00783                     self.allow_simple_key = True
00784             else:
00785                 found = True
00786 
00787     def scan_directive(self):
00788         # See the specification for details.
00789         start_mark = self.get_mark()
00790         self.forward()
00791         name = self.scan_directive_name(start_mark)
00792         value = None
00793         if name == u'YAML':
00794             value = self.scan_yaml_directive_value(start_mark)
00795             end_mark = self.get_mark()
00796         elif name == u'TAG':
00797             value = self.scan_tag_directive_value(start_mark)
00798             end_mark = self.get_mark()
00799         else:
00800             end_mark = self.get_mark()
00801             while self.peek() not in u'\0\r\n\x85\u2028\u2029':
00802                 self.forward()
00803         self.scan_directive_ignored_line(start_mark)
00804         return DirectiveToken(name, value, start_mark, end_mark)
00805 
00806     def scan_directive_name(self, start_mark):
00807         # See the specification for details.
00808         length = 0
00809         ch = self.peek(length)
00810         while u'0' <= ch <= u'9' or u'A' <= ch <= 'Z' or u'a' <= ch <= 'z'  \
00811                 or ch in u'-_':
00812             length += 1
00813             ch = self.peek(length)
00814         if not length:
00815             raise ScannerError("while scanning a directive", start_mark,
00816                     "expected alphabetic or numeric character, but found %r"
00817                     % ch.encode('utf-8'), self.get_mark())
00818         value = self.prefix(length)
00819         self.forward(length)
00820         ch = self.peek()
00821         if ch not in u'\0 \r\n\x85\u2028\u2029':
00822             raise ScannerError("while scanning a directive", start_mark,
00823                     "expected alphabetic or numeric character, but found %r"
00824                     % ch.encode('utf-8'), self.get_mark())
00825         return value
00826 
00827     def scan_yaml_directive_value(self, start_mark):
00828         # See the specification for details.
00829         while self.peek() == u' ':
00830             self.forward()
00831         major = self.scan_yaml_directive_number(start_mark)
00832         if self.peek() != '.':
00833             raise ScannerError("while scanning a directive", start_mark,
00834                     "expected a digit or '.', but found %r"
00835                     % self.peek().encode('utf-8'),
00836                     self.get_mark())
00837         self.forward()
00838         minor = self.scan_yaml_directive_number(start_mark)
00839         if self.peek() not in u'\0 \r\n\x85\u2028\u2029':
00840             raise ScannerError("while scanning a directive", start_mark,
00841                     "expected a digit or ' ', but found %r"
00842                     % self.peek().encode('utf-8'),
00843                     self.get_mark())
00844         return (major, minor)
00845 
00846     def scan_yaml_directive_number(self, start_mark):
00847         # See the specification for details.
00848         ch = self.peek()
00849         if not (u'0' <= ch <= '9'):
00850             raise ScannerError("while scanning a directive", start_mark,
00851                     "expected a digit, but found %r" % ch.encode('utf-8'),
00852                     self.get_mark())
00853         length = 0
00854         while u'0' <= self.peek(length) <= u'9':
00855             length += 1
00856         value = int(self.prefix(length))
00857         self.forward(length)
00858         return value
00859 
00860     def scan_tag_directive_value(self, start_mark):
00861         # See the specification for details.
00862         while self.peek() == u' ':
00863             self.forward()
00864         handle = self.scan_tag_directive_handle(start_mark)
00865         while self.peek() == u' ':
00866             self.forward()
00867         prefix = self.scan_tag_directive_prefix(start_mark)
00868         return (handle, prefix)
00869 
00870     def scan_tag_directive_handle(self, start_mark):
00871         # See the specification for details.
00872         value = self.scan_tag_handle('directive', start_mark)
00873         ch = self.peek()
00874         if ch != u' ':
00875             raise ScannerError("while scanning a directive", start_mark,
00876                     "expected ' ', but found %r" % ch.encode('utf-8'),
00877                     self.get_mark())
00878         return value
00879 
00880     def scan_tag_directive_prefix(self, start_mark):
00881         # See the specification for details.
00882         value = self.scan_tag_uri('directive', start_mark)
00883         ch = self.peek()
00884         if ch not in u'\0 \r\n\x85\u2028\u2029':
00885             raise ScannerError("while scanning a directive", start_mark,
00886                     "expected ' ', but found %r" % ch.encode('utf-8'),
00887                     self.get_mark())
00888         return value
00889 
00890     def scan_directive_ignored_line(self, start_mark):
00891         # See the specification for details.
00892         while self.peek() == u' ':
00893             self.forward()
00894         if self.peek() == u'#':
00895             while self.peek() not in u'\0\r\n\x85\u2028\u2029':
00896                 self.forward()
00897         ch = self.peek()
00898         if ch not in u'\0\r\n\x85\u2028\u2029':
00899             raise ScannerError("while scanning a directive", start_mark,
00900                     "expected a comment or a line break, but found %r"
00901                         % ch.encode('utf-8'), self.get_mark())
00902         self.scan_line_break()
00903 
00904     def scan_anchor(self, TokenClass):
00905         # The specification does not restrict characters for anchors and
00906         # aliases. This may lead to problems, for instance, the document:
00907         #   [ *alias, value ]
00908         # can be interpteted in two ways, as
00909         #   [ "value" ]
00910         # and
00911         #   [ *alias , "value" ]
00912         # Therefore we restrict aliases to numbers and ASCII letters.
00913         start_mark = self.get_mark()
00914         indicator = self.peek()
00915         if indicator == '*':
00916             name = 'alias'
00917         else:
00918             name = 'anchor'
00919         self.forward()
00920         length = 0
00921         ch = self.peek(length)
00922         while u'0' <= ch <= u'9' or u'A' <= ch <= 'Z' or u'a' <= ch <= 'z'  \
00923                 or ch in u'-_':
00924             length += 1
00925             ch = self.peek(length)
00926         if not length:
00927             raise ScannerError("while scanning an %s" % name, start_mark,
00928                     "expected alphabetic or numeric character, but found %r"
00929                     % ch.encode('utf-8'), self.get_mark())
00930         value = self.prefix(length)
00931         self.forward(length)
00932         ch = self.peek()
00933         if ch not in u'\0 \t\r\n\x85\u2028\u2029?:,]}%@`':
00934             raise ScannerError("while scanning an %s" % name, start_mark,
00935                     "expected alphabetic or numeric character, but found %r"
00936                     % ch.encode('utf-8'), self.get_mark())
00937         end_mark = self.get_mark()
00938         return TokenClass(value, start_mark, end_mark)
00939 
00940     def scan_tag(self):
00941         # See the specification for details.
00942         start_mark = self.get_mark()
00943         ch = self.peek(1)
00944         if ch == u'<':
00945             handle = None
00946             self.forward(2)
00947             suffix = self.scan_tag_uri('tag', start_mark)
00948             if self.peek() != u'>':
00949                 raise ScannerError("while parsing a tag", start_mark,
00950                         "expected '>', but found %r" % self.peek().encode('utf-8'),
00951                         self.get_mark())
00952             self.forward()
00953         elif ch in u'\0 \t\r\n\x85\u2028\u2029':
00954             handle = None
00955             suffix = u'!'
00956             self.forward()
00957         else:
00958             length = 1
00959             use_handle = False
00960             while ch not in u'\0 \r\n\x85\u2028\u2029':
00961                 if ch == u'!':
00962                     use_handle = True
00963                     break
00964                 length += 1
00965                 ch = self.peek(length)
00966             handle = u'!'
00967             if use_handle:
00968                 handle = self.scan_tag_handle('tag', start_mark)
00969             else:
00970                 handle = u'!'
00971                 self.forward()
00972             suffix = self.scan_tag_uri('tag', start_mark)
00973         ch = self.peek()
00974         if ch not in u'\0 \r\n\x85\u2028\u2029':
00975             raise ScannerError("while scanning a tag", start_mark,
00976                     "expected ' ', but found %r" % ch.encode('utf-8'),
00977                     self.get_mark())
00978         value = (handle, suffix)
00979         end_mark = self.get_mark()
00980         return TagToken(value, start_mark, end_mark)
00981 
00982     def scan_block_scalar(self, style):
00983         # See the specification for details.
00984 
00985         if style == '>':
00986             folded = True
00987         else:
00988             folded = False
00989 
00990         chunks = []
00991         start_mark = self.get_mark()
00992 
00993         # Scan the header.
00994         self.forward()
00995         chomping, increment = self.scan_block_scalar_indicators(start_mark)
00996         self.scan_block_scalar_ignored_line(start_mark)
00997 
00998         # Determine the indentation level and go to the first non-empty line.
00999         min_indent = self.indent+1
01000         if min_indent < 1:
01001             min_indent = 1
01002         if increment is None:
01003             breaks, max_indent, end_mark = self.scan_block_scalar_indentation()
01004             indent = max(min_indent, max_indent)
01005         else:
01006             indent = min_indent+increment-1
01007             breaks, end_mark = self.scan_block_scalar_breaks(indent)
01008         line_break = u''
01009 
01010         # Scan the inner part of the block scalar.
01011         while self.column == indent and self.peek() != u'\0':
01012             chunks.extend(breaks)
01013             leading_non_space = self.peek() not in u' \t'
01014             length = 0
01015             while self.peek(length) not in u'\0\r\n\x85\u2028\u2029':
01016                 length += 1
01017             chunks.append(self.prefix(length))
01018             self.forward(length)
01019             line_break = self.scan_line_break()
01020             breaks, end_mark = self.scan_block_scalar_breaks(indent)
01021             if self.column == indent and self.peek() != u'\0':
01022 
01023                 # Unfortunately, folding rules are ambiguous.
01024                 #
01025                 # This is the folding according to the specification:
01026                 
01027                 if folded and line_break == u'\n'   \
01028                         and leading_non_space and self.peek() not in u' \t':
01029                     if not breaks:
01030                         chunks.append(u' ')
01031                 else:
01032                     chunks.append(line_break)
01033                 
01034                 # This is Clark Evans's interpretation (also in the spec
01035                 # examples):
01036                 #
01037                 #if folded and line_break == u'\n':
01038                 #    if not breaks:
01039                 #        if self.peek() not in ' \t':
01040                 #            chunks.append(u' ')
01041                 #        else:
01042                 #            chunks.append(line_break)
01043                 #else:
01044                 #    chunks.append(line_break)
01045             else:
01046                 break
01047 
01048         # Chomp the tail.
01049         if chomping is not False:
01050             chunks.append(line_break)
01051         if chomping is True:
01052             chunks.extend(breaks)
01053 
01054         # We are done.
01055         return ScalarToken(u''.join(chunks), False, start_mark, end_mark,
01056                 style)
01057 
01058     def scan_block_scalar_indicators(self, start_mark):
01059         # See the specification for details.
01060         chomping = None
01061         increment = None
01062         ch = self.peek()
01063         if ch in u'+-':
01064             if ch == '+':
01065                 chomping = True
01066             else:
01067                 chomping = False
01068             self.forward()
01069             ch = self.peek()
01070             if ch in u'0123456789':
01071                 increment = int(ch)
01072                 if increment == 0:
01073                     raise ScannerError("while scanning a block scalar", start_mark,
01074                             "expected indentation indicator in the range 1-9, but found 0",
01075                             self.get_mark())
01076                 self.forward()
01077         elif ch in u'0123456789':
01078             increment = int(ch)
01079             if increment == 0:
01080                 raise ScannerError("while scanning a block scalar", start_mark,
01081                         "expected indentation indicator in the range 1-9, but found 0",
01082                         self.get_mark())
01083             self.forward()
01084             ch = self.peek()
01085             if ch in u'+-':
01086                 if ch == '+':
01087                     chomping = True
01088                 else:
01089                     chomping = False
01090                 self.forward()
01091         ch = self.peek()
01092         if ch not in u'\0 \r\n\x85\u2028\u2029':
01093             raise ScannerError("while scanning a block scalar", start_mark,
01094                     "expected chomping or indentation indicators, but found %r"
01095                         % ch.encode('utf-8'), self.get_mark())
01096         return chomping, increment
01097 
01098     def scan_block_scalar_ignored_line(self, start_mark):
01099         # See the specification for details.
01100         while self.peek() == u' ':
01101             self.forward()
01102         if self.peek() == u'#':
01103             while self.peek() not in u'\0\r\n\x85\u2028\u2029':
01104                 self.forward()
01105         ch = self.peek()
01106         if ch not in u'\0\r\n\x85\u2028\u2029':
01107             raise ScannerError("while scanning a block scalar", start_mark,
01108                     "expected a comment or a line break, but found %r"
01109                         % ch.encode('utf-8'), self.get_mark())
01110         self.scan_line_break()
01111 
01112     def scan_block_scalar_indentation(self):
01113         # See the specification for details.
01114         chunks = []
01115         max_indent = 0
01116         end_mark = self.get_mark()
01117         while self.peek() in u' \r\n\x85\u2028\u2029':
01118             if self.peek() != u' ':
01119                 chunks.append(self.scan_line_break())
01120                 end_mark = self.get_mark()
01121             else:
01122                 self.forward()
01123                 if self.column > max_indent:
01124                     max_indent = self.column
01125         return chunks, max_indent, end_mark
01126 
01127     def scan_block_scalar_breaks(self, indent):
01128         # See the specification for details.
01129         chunks = []
01130         end_mark = self.get_mark()
01131         while self.column < indent and self.peek() == u' ':
01132             self.forward()
01133         while self.peek() in u'\r\n\x85\u2028\u2029':
01134             chunks.append(self.scan_line_break())
01135             end_mark = self.get_mark()
01136             while self.column < indent and self.peek() == u' ':
01137                 self.forward()
01138         return chunks, end_mark
01139 
01140     def scan_flow_scalar(self, style):
01141         # See the specification for details.
01142         # Note that we loose indentation rules for quoted scalars. Quoted
01143         # scalars don't need to adhere indentation because " and ' clearly
01144         # mark the beginning and the end of them. Therefore we are less
01145         # restrictive then the specification requires. We only need to check
01146         # that document separators are not included in scalars.
01147         if style == '"':
01148             double = True
01149         else:
01150             double = False
01151         chunks = []
01152         start_mark = self.get_mark()
01153         quote = self.peek()
01154         self.forward()
01155         chunks.extend(self.scan_flow_scalar_non_spaces(double, start_mark))
01156         while self.peek() != quote:
01157             chunks.extend(self.scan_flow_scalar_spaces(double, start_mark))
01158             chunks.extend(self.scan_flow_scalar_non_spaces(double, start_mark))
01159         self.forward()
01160         end_mark = self.get_mark()
01161         return ScalarToken(u''.join(chunks), False, start_mark, end_mark,
01162                 style)
01163 
01164     ESCAPE_REPLACEMENTS = {
01165         u'0':   u'\0',
01166         u'a':   u'\x07',
01167         u'b':   u'\x08',
01168         u't':   u'\x09',
01169         u'\t':  u'\x09',
01170         u'n':   u'\x0A',
01171         u'v':   u'\x0B',
01172         u'f':   u'\x0C',
01173         u'r':   u'\x0D',
01174         u'e':   u'\x1B',
01175         u' ':   u'\x20',
01176         u'\"':  u'\"',
01177         u'\\':  u'\\',
01178         u'N':   u'\x85',
01179         u'_':   u'\xA0',
01180         u'L':   u'\u2028',
01181         u'P':   u'\u2029',
01182     }
01183 
01184     ESCAPE_CODES = {
01185         u'x':   2,
01186         u'u':   4,
01187         u'U':   8,
01188     }
01189 
01190     def scan_flow_scalar_non_spaces(self, double, start_mark):
01191         # See the specification for details.
01192         chunks = []
01193         while True:
01194             length = 0
01195             while self.peek(length) not in u'\'\"\\\0 \t\r\n\x85\u2028\u2029':
01196                 length += 1
01197             if length:
01198                 chunks.append(self.prefix(length))
01199                 self.forward(length)
01200             ch = self.peek()
01201             if not double and ch == u'\'' and self.peek(1) == u'\'':
01202                 chunks.append(u'\'')
01203                 self.forward(2)
01204             elif (double and ch == u'\'') or (not double and ch in u'\"\\'):
01205                 chunks.append(ch)
01206                 self.forward()
01207             elif double and ch == u'\\':
01208                 self.forward()
01209                 ch = self.peek()
01210                 if ch in self.ESCAPE_REPLACEMENTS:
01211                     chunks.append(self.ESCAPE_REPLACEMENTS[ch])
01212                     self.forward()
01213                 elif ch in self.ESCAPE_CODES:
01214                     length = self.ESCAPE_CODES[ch]
01215                     self.forward()
01216                     for k in range(length):
01217                         if self.peek(k) not in u'0123456789ABCDEFabcdef':
01218                             raise ScannerError("while scanning a double-quoted scalar", start_mark,
01219                                     "expected escape sequence of %d hexdecimal numbers, but found %r" %
01220                                         (length, self.peek(k).encode('utf-8')), self.get_mark())
01221                     code = int(self.prefix(length), 16)
01222                     chunks.append(unichr(code))
01223                     self.forward(length)
01224                 elif ch in u'\r\n\x85\u2028\u2029':
01225                     self.scan_line_break()
01226                     chunks.extend(self.scan_flow_scalar_breaks(double, start_mark))
01227                 else:
01228                     raise ScannerError("while scanning a double-quoted scalar", start_mark,
01229                             "found unknown escape character %r" % ch.encode('utf-8'), self.get_mark())
01230             else:
01231                 return chunks
01232 
01233     def scan_flow_scalar_spaces(self, double, start_mark):
01234         # See the specification for details.
01235         chunks = []
01236         length = 0
01237         while self.peek(length) in u' \t':
01238             length += 1
01239         whitespaces = self.prefix(length)
01240         self.forward(length)
01241         ch = self.peek()
01242         if ch == u'\0':
01243             raise ScannerError("while scanning a quoted scalar", start_mark,
01244                     "found unexpected end of stream", self.get_mark())
01245         elif ch in u'\r\n\x85\u2028\u2029':
01246             line_break = self.scan_line_break()
01247             breaks = self.scan_flow_scalar_breaks(double, start_mark)
01248             if line_break != u'\n':
01249                 chunks.append(line_break)
01250             elif not breaks:
01251                 chunks.append(u' ')
01252             chunks.extend(breaks)
01253         else:
01254             chunks.append(whitespaces)
01255         return chunks
01256 
01257     def scan_flow_scalar_breaks(self, double, start_mark):
01258         # See the specification for details.
01259         chunks = []
01260         while True:
01261             # Instead of checking indentation, we check for document
01262             # separators.
01263             prefix = self.prefix(3)
01264             if (prefix == u'---' or prefix == u'...')   \
01265                     and self.peek(3) in u'\0 \t\r\n\x85\u2028\u2029':
01266                 raise ScannerError("while scanning a quoted scalar", start_mark,
01267                         "found unexpected document separator", self.get_mark())
01268             while self.peek() in u' \t':
01269                 self.forward()
01270             if self.peek() in u'\r\n\x85\u2028\u2029':
01271                 chunks.append(self.scan_line_break())
01272             else:
01273                 return chunks
01274 
01275     def scan_plain(self):
01276         # See the specification for details.
01277         # We add an additional restriction for the flow context:
01278         #   plain scalars in the flow context cannot contain ',', ':' and '?'.
01279         # We also keep track of the `allow_simple_key` flag here.
01280         # Indentation rules are loosed for the flow context.
01281         chunks = []
01282         start_mark = self.get_mark()
01283         end_mark = start_mark
01284         indent = self.indent+1
01285         # We allow zero indentation for scalars, but then we need to check for
01286         # document separators at the beginning of the line.
01287         #if indent == 0:
01288         #    indent = 1
01289         spaces = []
01290         while True:
01291             length = 0
01292             if self.peek() == u'#':
01293                 break
01294             while True:
01295                 ch = self.peek(length)
01296                 if ch in u'\0 \t\r\n\x85\u2028\u2029'   \
01297                         or (not self.flow_level and ch == u':' and
01298                                 self.peek(length+1) in u'\0 \t\r\n\x85\u2028\u2029') \
01299                         or (self.flow_level and ch in u',:?[]{}'):
01300                     break
01301                 length += 1
01302             # It's not clear what we should do with ':' in the flow context.
01303             if (self.flow_level and ch == u':'
01304                     and self.peek(length+1) not in u'\0 \t\r\n\x85\u2028\u2029,[]{}'):
01305                 self.forward(length)
01306                 raise ScannerError("while scanning a plain scalar", start_mark,
01307                     "found unexpected ':'", self.get_mark(),
01308                     "Please check http://pyyaml.org/wiki/YAMLColonInFlowContext for details.")
01309             if length == 0:
01310                 break
01311             self.allow_simple_key = False
01312             chunks.extend(spaces)
01313             chunks.append(self.prefix(length))
01314             self.forward(length)
01315             end_mark = self.get_mark()
01316             spaces = self.scan_plain_spaces(indent, start_mark)
01317             if not spaces or self.peek() == u'#' \
01318                     or (not self.flow_level and self.column < indent):
01319                 break
01320         return ScalarToken(u''.join(chunks), True, start_mark, end_mark)
01321 
01322     def scan_plain_spaces(self, indent, start_mark):
01323         # See the specification for details.
01324         # The specification is really confusing about tabs in plain scalars.
01325         # We just forbid them completely. Do not use tabs in YAML!
01326         chunks = []
01327         length = 0
01328         while self.peek(length) in u' ':
01329             length += 1
01330         whitespaces = self.prefix(length)
01331         self.forward(length)
01332         ch = self.peek()
01333         if ch in u'\r\n\x85\u2028\u2029':
01334             line_break = self.scan_line_break()
01335             self.allow_simple_key = True
01336             prefix = self.prefix(3)
01337             if (prefix == u'---' or prefix == u'...')   \
01338                     and self.peek(3) in u'\0 \t\r\n\x85\u2028\u2029':
01339                 return
01340             breaks = []
01341             while self.peek() in u' \r\n\x85\u2028\u2029':
01342                 if self.peek() == ' ':
01343                     self.forward()
01344                 else:
01345                     breaks.append(self.scan_line_break())
01346                     prefix = self.prefix(3)
01347                     if (prefix == u'---' or prefix == u'...')   \
01348                             and self.peek(3) in u'\0 \t\r\n\x85\u2028\u2029':
01349                         return
01350             if line_break != u'\n':
01351                 chunks.append(line_break)
01352             elif not breaks:
01353                 chunks.append(u' ')
01354             chunks.extend(breaks)
01355         elif whitespaces:
01356             chunks.append(whitespaces)
01357         return chunks
01358 
01359     def scan_tag_handle(self, name, start_mark):
01360         # See the specification for details.
01361         # For some strange reasons, the specification does not allow '_' in
01362         # tag handles. I have allowed it anyway.
01363         ch = self.peek()
01364         if ch != u'!':
01365             raise ScannerError("while scanning a %s" % name, start_mark,
01366                     "expected '!', but found %r" % ch.encode('utf-8'),
01367                     self.get_mark())
01368         length = 1
01369         ch = self.peek(length)
01370         if ch != u' ':
01371             while u'0' <= ch <= u'9' or u'A' <= ch <= 'Z' or u'a' <= ch <= 'z'  \
01372                     or ch in u'-_':
01373                 length += 1
01374                 ch = self.peek(length)
01375             if ch != u'!':
01376                 self.forward(length)
01377                 raise ScannerError("while scanning a %s" % name, start_mark,
01378                         "expected '!', but found %r" % ch.encode('utf-8'),
01379                         self.get_mark())
01380             length += 1
01381         value = self.prefix(length)
01382         self.forward(length)
01383         return value
01384 
01385     def scan_tag_uri(self, name, start_mark):
01386         # See the specification for details.
01387         # Note: we do not check if URI is well-formed.
01388         chunks = []
01389         length = 0
01390         ch = self.peek(length)
01391         while u'0' <= ch <= u'9' or u'A' <= ch <= 'Z' or u'a' <= ch <= 'z'  \
01392                 or ch in u'-;/?:@&=+$,_.!~*\'()[]%':
01393             if ch == u'%':
01394                 chunks.append(self.prefix(length))
01395                 self.forward(length)
01396                 length = 0
01397                 chunks.append(self.scan_uri_escapes(name, start_mark))
01398             else:
01399                 length += 1
01400             ch = self.peek(length)
01401         if length:
01402             chunks.append(self.prefix(length))
01403             self.forward(length)
01404             length = 0
01405         if not chunks:
01406             raise ScannerError("while parsing a %s" % name, start_mark,
01407                     "expected URI, but found %r" % ch.encode('utf-8'),
01408                     self.get_mark())
01409         return u''.join(chunks)
01410 
01411     def scan_uri_escapes(self, name, start_mark):
01412         # See the specification for details.
01413         bytes = []
01414         mark = self.get_mark()
01415         while self.peek() == u'%':
01416             self.forward()
01417             for k in range(2):
01418                 if self.peek(k) not in u'0123456789ABCDEFabcdef':
01419                     raise ScannerError("while scanning a %s" % name, start_mark,
01420                             "expected URI escape sequence of 2 hexdecimal numbers, but found %r" %
01421                                 (self.peek(k).encode('utf-8')), self.get_mark())
01422             bytes.append(chr(int(self.prefix(2), 16)))
01423             self.forward(2)
01424         try:
01425             value = unicode(''.join(bytes), 'utf-8')
01426         except UnicodeDecodeError, exc:
01427             raise ScannerError("while scanning a %s" % name, start_mark, str(exc), mark)
01428         return value
01429 
01430     def scan_line_break(self):
01431         # Transforms:
01432         #   '\r\n'      :   '\n'
01433         #   '\r'        :   '\n'
01434         #   '\n'        :   '\n'
01435         #   '\x85'      :   '\n'
01436         #   '\u2028'    :   '\u2028'
01437         #   '\u2029     :   '\u2029'
01438         #   default     :   ''
01439         ch = self.peek()
01440         if ch in u'\r\n\x85':
01441             if self.prefix(2) == u'\r\n':
01442                 self.forward(2)
01443             else:
01444                 self.forward()
01445             return u'\n'
01446         elif ch in u'\u2028\u2029':
01447             self.forward()
01448             return ch
01449         return u''
01450
